channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023120686
item.description:
Report X-2023120686

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking, removed from trailer, and brought to QA. DescribePack: Inner seal on one bottle of Ecolab Daily Disinfectant Cleaner appeared to be corroded and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed right side up in a lined spill bin and brought to appropriate damage processing area.

item.title: Report X-2023120614
item.description:
Report X-2023120614

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking, removed from the trailer, and brought to QA. DescribePack: One 946mL spray bottle was leaking from under the cap, which was not discernably loose. No hazardous markings, repeated similar shipments, 6 that I can remember. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright in a spill bin and brought to appropriate damage processing area.

item.title: Report E-2023120476
item.description:
Report E-2023120476

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, six (6) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for further evaluation.
